alert.note: Alert for Lenawee; Livingston; Macomb; Monroe; Oakland; St. Clair; Washtenaw; Wayne (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 17 at 11:55AM EST until February 18 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 3 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and some mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches and ice accumulations of a tenth to two tenths south of I-94. * WHERE...Livingston, Oakland, Macomb, Washtenaw, St. Clair, Lenawee, Monroe and Wayne Counties. * WHEN...From 3 PM this afternoon to 3 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel will become very difficult. The hazardous conditions will impact the Thursday evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures have or will shortly be dropping below freezing, with patches of light freezing rain or freezing drizzle leading to some icy surfaces this afternoon. Heavier precipitation will develop after 3 PM, mostly in the form of snow, except south of I-94 where sleet and freezing rain persists late in the day. All locations will see heavy snow this evening, with the peak snowfall rates occuring between 5-11 PM this evening. Snow then looks to taper off around and just after midnight. Some blowing and drifting of snow will occur tonight with northerly winds gusting up around 20 mph and temperatures falling to near 10 degrees toward Friday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.

area.areaDesc: Lenawee; Livingston; Macomb; Monroe; Oakland; St. Clair; Washtenaw; Wayne
